timeline.bodyText: Field shadowing is a bad thing
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: So much changes in this class, new methods, but no changed/new tests?
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: BaseDecorator is heavily tested by instrumentation tests
replies.author: trask

timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: trask

timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: Does not look right to me. Passing span name as statement?
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: can u explain your concern here?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
Old code passed cmd.getClass().getName() to onStatement method. Ok, looks good: using class name for RedisCommand subclass as query string.
New code calls DECORATE.spanNameForClass and decides to pass this to onStatement method. Does not look good: using span name (which can change in future) as query string?
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
from https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/specification/trace/semantic_conventions/database.md:

Span name should be set to low cardinality value representing the statement executed on the database

in this case the statement is already low cardinality, so it serves for both span name and statement.
i'm not clear on what you'd like to change here, can you propose a specific change?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
I propose to pass cmd.getClass().getName() to DECORATE.onStatement method instead of the result of the DECOREATE.spanNameForClass().
Look at it this way: does DECORATE.onStatement(span, DECOREATE.spanNameForClass(cmd)) make sense to you? Question is not in cardinality, question is in semantics. onStatement expects to receive the equivalent of database query. Span name can be changed at any moment and may be completely different from database query.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
Span name can be changed at any moment

not without breaking our tests
why would we calculate the same value twice, when we can calculate it once and use it in two places?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText:
So you are Ok with DECORATE.onStatement(span, DECOREATE.spanNameForClass(cmd))? For me this code is currently passing span name as a db query. It just happens atm that they have the same value, but this is accidental.
Technically this code is right now correct, so I will not object to this PR. But this "homonym" will bite us in the future, I am sure :)
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: will your concern go away once we migrate to the new DatabaseClientTracer (where you've made the spanName / statement separation more clear)?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Hm, in fact I believe yes :)
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText:
Even worse thing is that I created 3rd name for the same var. It also called bootstrapJarLocation :
https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/blob/03ec987180f3f79bb355690ac080c344e9bee906/dd-java-agent/agent-bootstrap/src/main/java/datadog/trace/bootstrap/DatadogClassLoader.java#L31 which I think is better.
I think it should be one name for this var across all methods.
Please help me which name to choose:

bootstrapURL
bootstrapJarLocation
ddJavaAgentJarURL
something else ?
replies.author: lpriima

replies.bodyText: i like ddJavaAgentJarURL, i think it is very descriptive. i did fix it just now to remove the dd prefix in this repo. @iNikem was that your concern?
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Yes, dd was my problem :)
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.bodyText: Why is this better than AgentBootstrap.class?
timeline.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: Looks like it could be either: https://github.com/DataDog/dd-trace-java/pull/1561/files#r437482125
replies.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: I argue that AgentBootstrap.class is much easier to understand.
replies.author: iNikem

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: trask

timeline.author: lpriima

replies.bodyText: I want gradle formatter to do that for me.
replies.author: lpriima

replies.bodyText: done
replies.author: trask

timeline.author: trask

timeline.message: Upgradle gradle to 6.5 (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1589)
Add some tests for Java CompletableFuture (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1546)
ApacheHttpClientRedirectInstrumentation copy headers from original request to redirect if original redirect headers were empty (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1539)

Allow the mock http server get assigned a transient port (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1540)

This change should eradicate the spurious test failures due to port conflicts - at least for the profiling smoke tests.
Split muzzle across multiple executors (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1549)
Update play-2.6 instrumentation to support Play version 2.8.x (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1521)
Fix future cancelation (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1555)
Cache span names derived from class and method names (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1562)
Disable agent if we may append wrong jar to bootclasspath (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1561)
Circleci config cleanup (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1564)
Create context store map at most once (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1570)
Do not attempt to instrument websocket upgrade handlers (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1567)
Avoid creating new strings prior to jar lookup (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1580)
Iterate type interfaces without materialising a list during super type matching (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1578)
Introduce matcher for membership of a set of names (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1583)
BaseDecorator shouldn't rely on $ in class names (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1585)
Replace remaining named disjunctions with namedOneOf or namedNoneOf (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1584)
Upgradle gradle to 6.5 (DataDog/dd-trace-java#1589)
